result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul Mcguire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Pay supervision fees.
Court set restitution at zero.

No contact with victim until the defendant starts his batterer's treatment, then the no contact order may be modified to no violent contact with the agent's approval.  The defendant may have 3rd party contact to spend time with the children.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Mcguire

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Paul Mcguire not in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The DOC has issued a warrant for the defendant's arrest and imposed condition time.  The court initially ordered 30 days condition time but then vacated that order.  There is no condition time left at this time.  If the defendant is picked up, the DOC will revoke him.

Defendant Paul Mcguire in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 80 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 15 months with the following conditions:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim until the defendant starts his batterer's treatment, then the no contact order may be modified to no violent contact with the agent's approval.  The defendant may have 3rd party contact to spend time with the children.  
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Paul Mcguire in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The court is not in session today.
Case adjourned for a sentencing date in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Paul Mcguire in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
This case was calendared for a jury trial today but the defendant wants to change his plea.
Plea hearing continued....
.
As to count 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Paul Mcguire in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to successor court to be determined in Room 502 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Amy S or her three minor children.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Paul Mcguire in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  
Defendant Paul Mcguire in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan Branc 4.  
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady , Branch 23.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Paul Mcguire
Current: 3335 Grange Ave, Cudahy, WI 53110   (Effective: 03-31-2015)
Prior: 5262A South Nicholson Avenue, Cudahy, WI 53110
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
